CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . She resides in the village of GPE , GPE . The applicant is the mother of Mr Abdula Edilov , born in DATE .

CARDINAL . At the time of the events described below LOC resided with the applicant at CARDINAL , FAC in the village of LOC . According to the applicant , her son had participated in illegal armed groups during the first round of hostilities in GPE , but was then amnestied and did not take part in the second round of hostilities which started in DATE .

CARDINAL . The following account of the events is based on a written statement by the applicant dated DATE ; a written statement by GPE dated DATE ; a written statement by GPE dated DATE and a written statement by PERSON dated DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant agreed with PERSON that she would go to the local market and that he would join her there later . The applicant left for the market while LOC stayed at home .

CARDINAL . DATE on DATE a light coloured UAZ vehicle ( “ таблетка ” ) arrived at the applicant ’s house . CARDINAL armed men in camouflage uniforms and masks emerged from the vehicle . The applicant ’s neighbours GPE , GPE and FAC , who witnessed the arrival of the vehicle , inferred that those men were servicemen . CARDINAL servicemen stayed by the UAZ vehicle and the others rushed inside the applicant ’s house . Shortly thereafter the servicemen came outside , leading Abdula Edilov with them . He was wearing a T - shirt , black trousers and house slippers and was holding his hands behind his back . The servicemen threw the applicant ’s son inside the UAZ vehicle and drove in the direction of the checkpoint manned by NORP federal forces located on the bridge over LOC , on the eastern outskirts of PERSON . At the checkpoint the vehicle stopped for a while and then took the motorway in the direction of ORG . According to GPE , the windows in the ORG vehicle were not blacked out and when it drove away from the checkpoint there were CARDINAL servicemen in it . GPE inferred from that that several servicemen must have stayed at the checkpoint . GPE , GPE and PERSON could clearly see the route taken by the UAZ vehicle because the motorway leading to ORG was separated from FAC only by the LOC canal .

CARDINAL . The applicant learnt about the abduction shortly after it had occurred . She immediately returned home and realised that her house had been searched because everything had been turned upside down .

CARDINAL . The applicant then went to the checkpoint of the federal forces located at the bridge over LOC . According to her , the checkpoint was guarded by servicemen from the ORG unit of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) . She told them that her son had been apprehended and that his abductors had passed through the checkpoint . The servicemen replied that their commander was absent and that her son would come back “ DATE if he was innocent ” or “ DATE if he was guilty ” .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant complained in person about the abduction of her son to the local police . A police officer named “ Yusup ” advised her to complain about the apprehension of LOC to various authorities and promised her that he would search for her son and find out who had arrested him and for what reason .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant stayed at home in case the authorities came to question her about the circumstances of the abduction of her son , whilst her sister GPE . went to PERSON to complain about his abduction to various ORG authorities .

CARDINAL . According to a written statement by PERSON . dated DATE , on CARDINAL or DATE GPE . and her husband heard over the radio that “ PERSON Edilov ” had been arrested on suspicion of having committed a terrorist attack in LOC of GPE and DATE she saw the same information on the federal news , accompanied by video footage of a man being led by CARDINAL servicemen . The video being very short , PERSON . was unable to discern whether the man was LOC , but she clearly heard his name being pronounced by the newsreader .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant learnt from a certain PERSON that her son was allegedly being held at the military base in GPE and in DATE a certain PERSON told the applicant ’s daughter - in - law that Abdula Edilov was being held at the Operational and ORG no . CARDINAL ( “ the ORB-CARDINAL ” ) in PERSON . The applicant went to PERSON to meet the head of the ORG , but the latter denied having detained her son .

CARDINAL . In DATE an officer of a prison located in PERSON , in GPE , allegedly recognised FAC in a picture shown to him by the applicant and told her that her son had been detained in that prison DATE before and that he had then been taken away by officers of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . The Government stated that at TIME on DATE a group of armed men in camouflage uniforms and masks , driving a UAZ vehicle , had abducted LOC from his home in GPE , GPE , and had taken him to an unknown destination .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE ( “ the NORP prosecutor ’s office ” ) forwarded the complaint about the abduction of Abdula Edilov to the prosecutor ’s office of LOC ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) and instructed the latter authority to verify her submissions and to take the necessary measures .

CARDINAL . On DATE the acting prosecutor of LOC forwarded the complaint about the abduction of LOC to the head of ORG of ORG ( “ the NORP ” ) and instructed the latter body to institute a criminal investigation and to take initial investigative steps , should there be grounds to do so .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG launched a criminal investigation into the abduction of Abdula Edilov under LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The case file was assigned the number DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was granted victim status in the proceedings in case no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant that it had examined her application for assistance in the search for her son and had studied case file no.CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation of the case had been entrusted to the district prosecutor ’s office which , on an unspecified date , had decided to suspend it owing to the failure to identify the perpetrators . However , that decision had been set aside as premature and unfounded and the district prosecutor ’s office had been instructed to take unspecified additional investigative steps aimed at identifying those responsible and locating the applicant ’s son .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the NORP prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant ’s repeated requests for information , specifying that the investigation in case no.CARDINAL had been suspended on DATE because of the failure to identify those responsible for the abduction . The applicant was further informed that on DATE the investigation had been resumed and that the district prosecutor ’s office would inform her about any further developments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor ’s office of ORG ( “ the ORG military prosecutor ’s office ” ) forwarded the applicant ’s complaint about the abduction of Abdula Edilov to the military prosecutor of military base no . DATE and instructed the latter body to examine it and to inform the applicant of any decisions taken . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the military prosecutor ’s office of military base no . CARDINAL transmitted the applicant ’s complaint to the military commander of the Urus - Martanovskiy District for examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the district prosecutor ’s office . She described in detail the apprehension of her son and submitted that she had immediately alerted all the relevant ORG bodies to his abduction . She stressed that the abductors had passed through the checkpoint of the federal forces unhindered and had freely moved around in broad daylight . She pointed out that the district prosecutor ’s office had not apprised her of any developments in the investigation and requested to be updated in writing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant that criminal case no . DATE had been opened on DATE and that on DATE the investigation had been suspended owing to the failure to identify the culprits .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the military commander of the Urus - Martanovskiy District . She described the circumstances of her son ’s abduction by armed men in camouflage uniforms , who had arrived in a light - coloured UAZ vehicle without licence plates , and sought assistance in establishing his whereabouts . On DATE she wrote a letter along the same lines to the district prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant that on DATE the investigation had been suspended but that at the same time the PERSON had been instructed to activate the search for those responsible for the abduction of LOC .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the applicant that on DATE it had resumed the investigation in case no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the military prosecutor and the prosecutor of GPE , describing in detail the circumstances of the abduction of her son and stressing that his abductors had passed through the checkpoint of the federal forces unhindered and that her relatives had heard on the Chechen State radio and television that NORP servicemen had arrested LOC on suspicion of having committed terrorist attacks and had seen footage of him in a TV reportage . She also stated that the description of LOC clothes by the relative who had seen him on TV fully corresponded to the clothes he had been wearing at the time of his abduction . Lastly , the applicant stressed that she had passed on that information in all her applications to ORG bodies but they had disregarded it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant ’s query and informed her that on DATE the investigation in case no . DATE had been suspended owing to the failure to identify those responsible for the abduction of her son . At the same time operational and search measures aimed at establishing LOC whereabouts and identifying his abductors were under way .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office wrote to the applicant that on the same date the investigation in case no . DATE had been resumed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the district prosecutor ’s office about the procrastination of the investigation into the abduction of her son and the lack of any information on its progress . She reiterated all the circumstances of the abduction of PERSON and sought permission to have access to the case file and to make copies from it . She also requested that the investigation be resumed if it had previously been suspended .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant that the investigators had taken all steps which could have been taken in the absence of persons to be charged with the abduction of her son and that they had found no grounds to resume the investigation . The letter further stated that the applicant would be entitled to have access to the case file once the investigation had been completed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant ’s query that operational and search measures aimed at establishing the whereabouts of her son were under way .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that they had provided a copy of the entire criminal file no . DATE . Some of the documents furnished by them were partly illegible ; most of the documents bore double numbering . The information contained in the documents submitted can be summarised as follows :

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG town prosecutor ’s office received a complaint by GPE about the abduction of LOC . The complaint bore a handwritten note dated DATE and reading “ to be transferred to the prosecutor ’s office of the Urus - Martanovskiy District ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecutor ’s office received a further complaint about LOC abduction , dated DATE .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of the Interior ( “ the ROVD ” ) returned to the NORP the materials concerning the abduction of FAC , submitting that on CARDINAL and DATE the district prosecutor ’s office had instructed the latter authority to examine those materials and to decide on whether a criminal investigation should be launched . However , on DATE the ORG had simply sent those materials to the ROVD , without taking a formal decision on the matter .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG opened a criminal investigation into the abduction of Abdula Edilov under LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The case file was given the number DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG transferred criminal file no . DATE to the district prosecutor ’s office for investigation and on DATE the latter authority took charge of the investigation .

CARDINAL . In their written explanations ( “ объяснение ” ) to the ROVD of DATE , GPE and PERSON stated that CARDINAL on DATE , in broad daylight , a group of CARDINAL armed persons wearing camouflage uniforms and masks had arrived at the applicant ’s house in a light - coloured UAZ vehicle ( “ таблетка ” ) . CARDINAL of the armed men had stayed in the car while others had gone inside the house . They had taken PERSON , who was handcuffed , outside , loaded him into their vehicle and left through the checkpoint , guarded by ORG officers from GPE . GPE , in the direction of PERSON .

CARDINAL . In her written explanation of DATE the applicant submitted that she had learnt about the abduction of her son by armed masked men wearing camouflage uniforms and driving a UAZ vehicle from the neighbours on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the first applicant victim status and interviewed her . She submitted that on DATE she had gone to the market , where FAC had been supposed to join her . However , after TIME a neighbour had come and told her that her son had been abducted by armed men in camouflage uniforms driving a UAZ vehicle . After she had returned home she had found everything turned upside down . She also stated that FAC had owed a certain sum of money to a certain T. , with whom he had been involved in a traffic accident , and that her son had had no enemies .

CARDINAL . When re - interviewed as a witness on DATE , GPE confirmed her previous account of the events . PERSON , a resident of PERSON interviewed on DATE , recounted the same circumstances concerning the abduction of FAC .
CARDINAL . Re - interviewed on DATE , the applicant confirmed her earlier accounts of the events concerning the abduction of GPE and GPE , questioned on DATE , gave a similar version of the events .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators questioned ORG as a witness . She stated that CARDINAL on DATE she had learnt from the applicant about the abduction of LOC . Together they had gone to the applicant ’s house , where everything had been turned upside down . The eyewitnesses had told them that armed persons wearing masks and camouflage uniforms and driving a UAZ vehicle without licence plates had searched the house , loaded FAC into their car and had left in the direction of ORG after having passed through the checkpoint located at the exit from PERSON . After a while there had been rumours that the applicant ’s son was detained in the CARDINALth department of ORG but GPE herself was not aware of the source of those rumours .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed ORG as a witness . He submitted that in DATE in the village of GPE he had been involved in a car accident with a man he had not met before . The other man had recognised that he had been at fault and had offered to repair ORG ’s vehicle , but had failed to do so , and ORG had had to repair it himself . DATE after the accident ORG had heard that the other man had been abducted and had disappeared .

CARDINAL . L.D. , re - interviewed as a witness on DATE , confirmed her earlier account of the events and FAC , questioned on DATE , gave a similar account of the circumstances of the abduction of the applicant ’s son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators re - interviewed the applicant . She stated , among other things , that her relative PERSON had seen a news report showing footage of FAC . In the applicant ’s submission , in DATE she had gone to a prison in PERSON and a prison guard to whom she had shown her son ’s picture had allegedly recognised him and told her that he had seen LOC in prison DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the investigators interviewed the applicant ’s neighbours GPE and Z.P.T. as witnesses . They stated that they had learnt about the abduction of the applicant ’s son from the neighbours and that they had never told the applicant that LOC had been detained by ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office requested the PERSON and the ROVD to inform it as to whether FAC was or had been held in those authorities’ detention facilities .

CARDINAL . DATE the district prosecutor ’s office requested a number of ORG authorities , including ORG in GPE ( “ ORG of the ORG ” ) , to inform it whether they had information on the whereabouts of FAC and whether he had participated in illegal armed groups and had been criminally prosecuted or detained by those ORG bodies . In reply , the ORG authorities informed the district prosecutor ’s office that they had not arrested PERSON and had no information on his whereabouts .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of the ORG informed the district prosecutor ’s office that they had not arrested PERSON and that , should they obtain information on his whereabouts , they would inform the latter authority accordingly .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the deputy prosecutor of the district prosecutor ’s office instructed the investigators in case no . DATE to carry out a crime scene inspection , identify and question the servicemen who had been on duty at the checkpoint on DATE of the applicant ’s son ’s abduction , verify information to the effect that NORP TV and radio channels had disseminated information on Abdula Edilov ’s arrest , identify and interview further witnesses to his abduction and take further investigative steps .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators requested ORG and ORG to inform them whether they had disseminated information on GPE arrest by security forces on suspicion of terrorist activities . On DATE they instructed ROVD officers to take the investigative steps mentioned in the letter of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the ROVD report of DATE , ORG officers orally interviewed unspecified residents of PERSON and were unable to identify further witnesses to the abduction .

CARDINAL . By their report of CARDINAL DATE the ROVD informed the district prosecutor ’s office that it was unable to identify the servicemen of the checkpoint on duty on DATE of GPE abduction “ because the servicemen worked in TIME shifts ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the district prosecutor ’s office requested a number of law - enforcement authorities , including ORG of ORG , to inform it as to whether they had information on the whereabouts of LOC , whether they had arrested him or had any “ compromising material ” ( “ компрометирующий материал ” ) concerning him .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the district prosecutor ’s office requested a number of hospitals in GPE to inform it as to whether LOC had applied to them for medical assistance . It follows from the relevant replies that he had not done so .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG informed the district prosecutor ’s office that operational and search measures carried out by ORG of the ORG had not enabled the abductors of FAC to be identified .

CARDINAL . On DATE the State TV and ORG “ Vaynakh ” informed the district prosecutor ’s office that they had not disseminated any information concerning the abduction of LOC in DATE by unidentified persons .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the district prosecutor ’s office reiterated its requests to a number of law - enforcement authorities and medical institutions for information on LOC whereabouts . In reply , those authorities submitted that they had no relevant information concerning the applicant ’s son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation into the abduction of PERSON owing to the failure to identify the perpetrators . It transpires that on DATE that decision was set aside by higher - ranking prosecutors ; the Government failed to furnish a copy of the related decisions .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the district prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation in case no . DATE for failure to identify those responsible for the abduction on the following dates : DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . The documents submitted by the Government show that higher - ranking prosecutors set aside the decisions to suspend the investigation on the following dates : DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . In setting aside the decisions to suspend the investigation , the higher - ranking prosecutors indicated that their examination of the case file had revealed that the district prosecutor ’s office had conducted the investigation in a superficial manner and in breach of the relevant legislation , referring , among other things , to the fact that the investigators had failed to identify and interview the servicemen who had been on duty at the checkpoint through which the abductors had passed with LOC ; to identify all eyewitnesses to the abduction ; to identify and question the persons with whom PERSON had been in contact and who could have information on the reasons for his abduction ; to check the unidentified victims database and to verify the applicant ’s and GPE ’s submissions that LOC may have been detained at the ORG and that NORP TV and radio channels had disseminated information concerning his arrest . In that connection , on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE higher - ranking prosecutors specifically issued “ written instructions ” ( “ письменные указания ” ) , requesting that the district prosecutor ’s office take the investigative steps in question .
DATE . On an unspecified date the investigation in case no . DATE was entrusted to the investigating department of ORG with ORG of GPE in GPE ( “ the investigating department ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy head of the investigating department issued “ written instructions ” concerning case no . DATE . The document stated , in particular , that the investigating department was to resume the investigation into the abduction of LOC without delay and to carry out , among others , the following investigative steps :
- identify and interview the servicemen on duty at the checkpoint on DATE ;
- add to the case file information from registration logbooks concerning vehicles which passed through the checkpoint on DATE ;
- identify the detachments of security forces stationed at the material time in LOC and in the vicinity of the village of GPE and obtain information on the special operations carried out by them ;
- carry out a crime - scene inspection and compile a detailed sketch showing the location of the applicant ’s house and the checkpoint of the federal forces ;
- re - interview witnesses to the abduction in detail on the events of DATE , and ;
- interview the applicant on the source of her information concerning her son ’s alleged detention in the GPE in PERSON .
CARDINAL . In the ORG ’s submission , the investigation of the disappearance of PERSON is ongoing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the Urus - Martanovskiy District Court ( “ the ORG ” ) about the ineffectiveness of the investigation into the abduction of her son and the investigator ’s refusal to grant her access to the case file and to allow her to make copies from it . In particular , she submitted that the circumstances of LOC abduction left no doubt that he had been apprehended by servicemen of the NORP military forces . However , the investigating authorities had not only delayed the investigation but also refused to provide her access to the case file . The applicant averred that the lack of information about the investigation prevented her from effectively challenging the decisions to suspend the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found partly for the applicant . It found that the investigator ’s refusal to provide her with access to the case file was unlawful . The court noted at the same time that the applicant would only be entitled to make copies from the case file after the completion of the investigation . As regards the request for the investigation to be resumed , the court found that the investigators had questioned several witnesses and obtained information on LOC eventual arrest and detention from a number of law - enforcement authorities , including the ORG department in GPE . The investigation had not established who was responsible for the abduction of FAC and it had been suspended on numerous occasions on that ground , the latest such decision being dated DATE . The court stressed , however , that the investigation had not taken all possible steps to establish LOC whereabouts and identify his abductors . In particular , the investigators had failed to identify and question the officers of the federal forces who had been on duty at the checkpoint over LOC on the eastern outskirts of GPE in DATE . The court thus granted the applicant ’s request and ordered that the investigation be resumed .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the applicant that it had resumed the investigation in case no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE rejected the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of DATE .
DATE . For a summary of the relevant domestic law see PERSON and PERSON GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE published on its official site www.fsb.ru , in the section covering data obtained from its regional departments , the following information :
“ During DATE CARDINAL insurgents have been liquidated and wounded , CARDINAL captured in GPE
CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL
GPE . DATE . INTERFAX

In the course of the special operations of the federal military and security forces in GPE [ conducted ] during DATE insurgents have lost CARDINAL men [ who have been ] killed and wounded , CARDINAL [ of them ] have been arrested with a view to establishing their involvement in illegal armed groups and in carrying out terrorist acts . In particular , according to the information of ORG in GPE , CARDINAL the majority of the special operations were conducted in the settlements of the LOC and GPE ( Alleroy , ORG , GPE , GPE , FAC , ORG ) and also in GPE , GPE and other villages .

During the same period of time a number of persons suspected of having committed terrorist acts in GPE were arrested ... PERSON , suspected of having carried out subversive acts against the federal forces in FAC , was arrested in the village of GPE ... ”
